rev.comment: Undid revision 438056028 by [[Special:Contributions/AndrePeltier|AndrePeltier]] ([[User talk:AndrePeltier|talk]]) The cited source mentions only one small plot point-just a quick passing allusion-homage- not "many specific plot points"
Still think if we omit composers with only one Bond film and screenwriters with only one Bond film, we should omit directors with only one Bond film

/* Pierce Brosnan (1995–2002) */ no rationale for this use

/* Felix Leiter */ Consolidate repetitive references to Jeffrey Wright as 2nd African-American (1st in EON series) to play Leiter
/* Pre-title sequence */ Clarify that segue from gunbarrel to pre-title ended with DAD (CR's gunbarrel was before titles, *not* pre-title; QoS' gunbarrel was at end of film)

Revert incorrect additions. Octopussy is a Fleming short story and story collection and not a novel. Dalton's "License" is not based on a novel. Goldfinger may be ally of Communists but is not an agent of them.
Changing fact: Stella Rimmington was MI5, not MI6
Added link to John Gavin's page
